location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 62 to Samuel Manesty, in Charge of the Honourable East India Company at Bussora [Basra], from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter acknowledges a letter received and congratulates Manesty on his role as temporarily in charge of affairs while Mr. Latouche is in Bagdat [Baghdad] and Aleppo. An additional note (on 13 March 1785) states that departure of the letter was delayed due to the arrival of His Majesty's Ship the Activeunder command of Captain Simon Mackenzie. It is stated that Mackenzie has packets of great consequence for both the government and the company and his movements are outlined in detail.
